English Content:
Brahmavidya is that by which Akshar [Aksharbrahman] and Purush [Purushottam] are thoroughly known.(Mundaka Upanishad - 1/2/13)

Therefore, the desire to know Brahman now commences. (Brahmasutra - 1/1/1)

English Content:
One who knows Aksharbrahman [becomes brahmarup] attains Parabrahma.(Taittiriya Upanishad, Anandvalli - 1)

Aksharbrahman is true, the form of knowledge, and endless. (Taittiriya Upanishad, Anandvalli)

From this Akshar, the entire world is created. (Mundaka Upanishad - 1/2/17)

O Gārgi, Under the control of this Aksharbrahman, the sun and the moon remain unstable. (Bruhadaranyaka Upanishad - 3/8/9)

This Aksharbrahman is the best support. This Aksharbrahman is the highest support. Upon knowing this support in the form of Aksharbrahman, one attains great bliss in Brahmalok [Akshardham]. (Katha Upanishad - 2/17)

In the divine Brahmapur [Akshardham] resides Aksharbrahman, the life-force of all beings. He is embodied with a divine mind, pran, form, etc. (Mundaka Upanishad - 2/2/7)

Gārgi! Those who die within this realm without realising this Aksharbrahman are miserable and pitiful. Believe that their birth has gone to waste. On the other hand, Gārgi! Only those who depart this world having realized this Akshar are the ones who truly understand Brahmavidya (Bruhadāranyaka Upanishad - 3/8/10)

Purushottam is superior to even Aksharbrahman, who is superior to all else.(Mundaka Upanishad - 2/1/2)

Nobody is superior to Purushottam. He is the ultimate entity. He is the highest attainment. (Katha Upanishad - 3/11)

English Content:
One who becomes Brahmarup,becomes internally fulfilled. He never laments nor has any material desires. He treats all as equal and attains supreme devotion to God.(Bhagavad Gita - 18/54)

To attain this Brahmavidhya one should surrender to a guru who is well versed in the shastras, is Aksharbrahman himself and has conviction in Parabrahman.(Mundaka Upanishad - 1/2/12)

This Aksharbrahman is a bridge for those who desire to cross the ocean of sansar [maya]. Nachiketa! With its help, one overcomes sansar, reaches Akshardham and attains Paramatma. (Katha Upanishad - 3/2)

In the same way that one offers supreme devotion to Parabrahman if one offers such devotion to the guru then all the wisdom of the Upanishads enlightens one’s heart. (Shvetashvatara Upanishad - 6/23)

Title (OPTIONAL): Akshar-Purushottam Siddhānt in the Swāminārāyaṇ Sampradāy
English Content:
During the evening sabha Mahant Swami Maharaj was asked, “In today’s program, the skit of Janiya Kaka (a character who ‘knows it all’) was presented. He knows everything about the world but nothing about Satsang. Thereafter, we told you that we are all like Janiya Kaka. We know everything about the world but nothing about Bhagwān. So Swami, please give us some words of advice”. (August 17, 2017, Houston)

Swami responded, “Āpṇe Māhārāj, Swāmi ane Satpurushne oḷkhyā, e sivāy kāi icchā na rākhvi. Emā gnān, dhyān, chār ved badhu āvi jāy. 'Sakal shāstrano sār param e Brahma ane Parabrahma. Biju karie pan ā muḷ na āve to jivan nakāmu. Ane ā āve to biju jānvāni jarur nahi."
 (“We have understood Maharaj, Swami, and the Satpurush. Do not keep any other desire besides that. In that, knowledge, meditation, the four Vedas, and all else are included. ‘The essence of all scriptures is Brahman and Parabrahman”. We can do other things, but if this is not rooted within us, then our life has been wasted. If you understand this, then there is nothing else to understand)
